page.title: 18COLWYN BAY SORTING OFFICE
page.content: The Colwyn Bay Sorting Office was built in November 1984 and was opened in the summer of 1985.It cost{Â£162000 paid by the Welsh Office.It was built alongside the Post Office because the new Expressway cut 17 ft. off the old sorting office.It has 17 vehicles which cover 4000 miles per week.There are{57 employees}at the office,3 of which are postal executives.The rest are postmen,some only part_time. The post,which consists of letters and parcels,arrives by train at the near-by station.600 bags arrive each week and 170 are despatched. On average{120000}letters arrive in season but only a{quarter}of that amount arrive out of season. The Colwyn Bay Sorting Office has no new technology _ all of the sorting is done by hand. Most outgoing mail is sent to Chester for sorting.
